lines.text:
[a dark, foggy street in London. Two bobbies are observing a young woman walking along furtively]
New one, isn't she Albert?
Must be, or she wouldn't be out on a night like this. No weather for a dog.
Just see to the aperitifs, will you?
[Dobbs, the butler, walks out of the frame and returns with a tray upon which is a carafe, presumably containing sherry]
Dobbs, you're... you're downright Victorian. We must have cocktails, Dobbs, cocktails!
Yes. Now don't tell me that it isn't British. You're deplorably behind the times. I drink 'em m'self. What's more, I can mix 'em. Mix is the word.
They tell me they even put *ice* in them in America.
Yes, well, I don't think we'll go quite that far.
